note.p: Education: Royal Military Academy, Woolwich; Honorary DCL (1829, Oxford)

Career: Lieutenant, Royal Artillery (1794); Captain (1804); commanded at Quebec; fought as Lieutenant Colonel at Corunna (1809); served again in Peninsula (1811-1812); Colonel (1814); Major General (1821); Governor of New Brunswick (1823-1829); Lord High Commissioner of the Ionian Islands (1835-1840); Lieutenant General (1837); Colonel 99th Foot (1841); Colonel 15th Foot (1851); General (1851); MP for Liverpool (1842-1847); Gentleman of the Bedchamber to the Duke of Gloucester; various appointments at the Royal Military College
Memberships: FRGS; AINA (notification arrived on the day of his death)
